sen.j: 筑波国造（つくばのくにのみやつこ・つくばこくぞう)は常陸国南部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Tsukubanokuninomiyatsuko (also known as Tsukubakokuzo) was Kujinomiyatsuko ruled the south part of Hitachi Province.
Tsukuba no kuninomiyatsuko (also known as Tsukubakokuzo) was Kuninomiyatsuko ruled the south part of Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: 表記変更スペルミス修正
sen.e: Tsukuba no kuninomiyatsuko (also known as Tsukubakokuzo) was Kuninomiyatsuko ruled the south part of Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 『常陸国風土記』によると、この地は昔は紀の国といっていたが、崇神天皇朝の国造の筑箪命が自分の名前の国名に改めたという。
sen.e: According to "Hitachinokuni Fudoki", this land was once called Ki no kuni, but Tsukubanomikoto who was kuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Sujin changed the name of Kuni to his name.
According to "Hitachinokuni Fudoki," this land was once called Ki no kuni, but Tsukuba no mikoto who was kuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Sujin changed the name of Kuni to his name.
sen.cmt: 表記変更カンマの位置を調整
sen.e: According to "Hitachinokuni Fudoki," this land was once called Ki no kuni, but Tsukuba no mikoto who was kuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Sujin changed the name of Kuni to his name.

sen.j: 『国造本紀』によると、成務天皇朝に忍凝見命の孫の阿閇色命が筑波国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: According to "Kuninomiyatsuko hongi", Aheshikonomikoto, a grandson of Oshikoriminomikoto, was appointed Tsukubanokuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
According to "Kuninomiyatsuko hongi", Aheshiko no mikoto, a grandson of Oshikorimi no mikoto, was appointed Tsukuba no kuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
According to "Kuninomiyatsuko hongi", Aheshiko no mikoto, a grandson of Oshikorimi no mikoto, was appointed Tsukuba no kuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
It was probably the Tsukuba clan.
It was probably the Tsukuba clan.
It was probably the Tsukuba clan.
Tsukuba Gun, Hitachi Province.
Tsukuba Gun, Hitachi Province.
Tsukuba Gun, Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 現在の茨城県つくば市・伊奈町・谷和原村。
sen.e: Present Tsukuba City, Inamachi, and Yawaramura in Ibaraki Prefecture.
Present Tsukuba City, Inamachi, and Yawaramura in Ibaraki Prefecture.
Present Tsukuba City, Inamachi, and Yawaramura in Ibaraki Prefecture.

sen.j: 筑波山神社 ...... 茨城県つくば市。
sen.e: Tsukubasan-jinja Shrine: Tsukuba City, Ibaraki Prefecture.
Tsukubasan-jinja Shrine: Tsukuba City, Ibaraki Prefecture.
Tsukubasan-jinja Shrine: Tsukuba City, Ibaraki Prefecture.

sen.j: 祭神は筑波男神・筑波女神。
sen.e: The enshrined deity was Tsukubaogami and Tsukubamegami.
The enshrined deity was Tsukubaogami and Tsukubamegami.
The enshrined deity was Tsukubaogami and Tsukubamegami.

sen.j: 筑波 某 ...... 神功皇后朝の豪族。
sen.e: Tsukuba X: A regional powerful clan during the Empress Jingu.
